diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute Retinal Necrosis caused by the Oka vaccine strain of Varicella zoster virus
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of acute retinal necrosis (ARN) was made based on the patient's presentation of symptoms, including floaters and retinal lesions, alongside cytological and molecular evidence confirming the presence of Varicella zoster virus (VZV) DNA from the vitreous fluid, which was identified as the vaccine Oka strain through whole genome sequencing.
